reviews.text: Iguazu is an expensive town for accomodations. For the money, Rio Selva is a good choice. It is simple, comfortable, older property with limited amenities, but better than a typical hostel. The few rooms are large, have aircon, a ceiling fan, and TV. The owners are very friendly and nice. The queen-size bed was comfortable, but I think anyone over about 6 feet tall will find it short. Rio Selva is located on a quiet edge of the town where you can hear birds in the morning. It is about a 15 minute walk into the center where the restaurants and shopping are, though the hotel next door (Los Troncos) has a very good restaurant. This hotel has a small outdoor pool, which is a treat on a hot day. Wherever you stay in Iguazu, if the weather is warm, choose a place with a pool. You'll be glad you did.
reviews.title: Good, basic accommodations
